nodes.title: Improvement: Adding links in contribution and code of conduct
nodes.bodyText:
Usually, other codebases follow this pattern, so I am suggesting these changes.
Feel free to close if you think it's not something you want.
Personally, I was going down by habit and I had to scroll back a few times, so I thought maybe this could help.

commit.message: Improvement: Adding links in contribution and code of conduct

nodes.bodyText: Thank you! @nerdjfpb

files_with_diffs.patch:
@@ -89,9 +89,9 @@ Whether it's a feature request, bug report, or a project to showcase, please get
 
 Contributions are always welcome!
 
-See `CONTRIBUTING.md` for ways to get started.
+See [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.MD) for ways to get started.
 
-Please adhere to this project's `CODE_OF_CONDUCT`.
+Please adhere to this project's [CODE_OF_CONDUCT](https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).
 
 ## License

nodes.title: Fix: Docs navbar height issue in tablet size
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #615
📝 Description
Some route buttons are hiding on width 1280 to lower
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Now route buttons items will take as much space they needed.
🚀 New behavior
Can use all the route buttons properly now
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No

commit.message: Fix: Docs navbar height issue in tablet size
Chores: removing props from upper level and remove unnecessary import
Fix typos in card component docs and storybook

Merge pull request #799 from Hdanzo/fix/component-card-docs-typo

Fix typos in card component docs and storybook (fix #792)
fix(docs-card): add missing import for code example

nodes.title: docs: fix grammar in loading docs
nodes.bodyText:
The property color should be changed to color property.

Closes #

🚀 New behavior

💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):

commit.message:
docs: fix grammar in loading docs

The property color should be changed to color property.

nodes.bodyText: Thanks! 🙌🏼

 />

nodes.title: fix(react-pagination): add active page to memoized callback deps
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #619
📝 Description
Reading state in pagination's onChange will always return the initial value.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Add activePage to the memoized callback deps.
🚀 New behavior
Update or changes if total, activePage (deps) has been changed.
Read more: usecallback.
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No
📝 Additional Information

Note The branch based on next.

commit.message: fix(react-pagination): add active page to memoized callback deps

nodes.body: onChange donot work when it receive a new value, and param page cannot bind a react state

nodes.bodyText: Thanks! @tianenpang 🚀

nodes.title: fix(react-dropdown): add collections and menu deps of react-stately
nodes.bodyText:
Closes https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/issues/534
📝 Description
The Dropdown component depends on @react-stately/collections and @react-stately/menu, but it isn't declared in its dependencies, which in some cases could cause a MODULE_NOT_FOUND error.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Add @react-stately/collections and @react-stately/menu.
🚀 New behavior
Install @react-stately/collections and @react-stately/menu as dependencies.
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No

commit.message: fix(react-dropdown): add collections and menu deps of react-stately

nodes.title: Feat/badge component
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #584 #312
📝 Description
The badge component has been created 🎉





💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): Yes
The margin of some HTML primitives has been removed from the CssBaseline
  "dl, dd, hr, figure, p": {
    margin: 0,
  },

commit.message: feat(react-badge): initial structure created, variants and styles
feat(badge): test passing, variants added, styles added
Merge branch 'next' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into feat/badge

files_with_diffs.patch:
@@ -0,0 +1,44 @@
+const App = `import { Badge, Grid } from "@nextui-org/react";
+
+export default function App() {
+  return (
+    <Grid.Container gap={2}>
+      <Grid>
+        <Badge variant="bordered">Neutral</Badge>
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid>
+        <Badge color="primary" variant="bordered">
+          Primary
+        </Badge>
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid>
+        <Badge color="secondary" variant="bordered">
+          Secondary
+        </Badge>
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid>
+        <Badge color="success" variant="bordered">
+          Success
+        </Badge>
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid>
+        <Badge color="warning" variant="bordered">
+          Warning
+        </Badge>
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid>
+        <Badge color="error" variant="bordered">
+          Error
+        </Badge>
+      </Grid>
+    </Grid.Container>
+  );
+}`;
+
+const react = {
+  "/App.js": App,
+};
+
+export default {
+  ...react,
+};

+---
+title: "Badge"
+description: "Badges are used as a small numerical value or status descriptor for UI elements."
+url: https://nextui.org/docs/components/badge
+---
+
+# Badge
+
+Badges are used as a small numerical value or status descriptor for UI elements.
+
+```jsx
+import { Badge } from "@nextui-org/react";
+```
+
+<CarbonAd />
+
+<Spacer y={2} />
+
+<Playground
+  title="Default"
+  desc="Badge with default styles, used in standalone when `content` prop is empty."
+  files={badgeContent.defaultBadge}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Sizes"
+  desc="Use `size` prop to change the size of the badge."
+  files={badgeContent.sizesBadge}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Colors"
+  desc="We preset a series of colorful Badge styles for use in different situations."
+  files={badgeContent.colorsBadge}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Shadow"
+  desc="Use `enableShadow` prop to add a shadow to the badge."
+  files={badgeContent.shadowBadge}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Dot"
+  desc="Use the `dot` variant to create a dot badge. Useful for indicating a status or showing a notification that there is new content."
+  files={badgeContent.dotBadge}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Points"
+  desc="Use the `points` variant to create a badge with a points animation. Useful for indicating a writing or loading status."
+  files={badgeContent.pointsBadge}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Bordered"
+  desc="Use the `bordered` variant to create a badge with a border and an empty background."
+  files={badgeContent.borderedBadge}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Flat"
+  desc="Use the `flat` variant to create a badge with a flat background that contrasts with the text based on the selected color. [Leran more about the color palette](/docs/theme/default-theme#understanding-the-base-scale)."
+  files={badgeContent.flatBadge}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Squared"
+  desc="Use the `isSquared` prop to create a badge with squared corners."
+  files={badgeContent.squaredBadge}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Content"
+  desc="If you pass the `content` prop, the badge will be rendered relative to its children."
+  files={badgeContent.contentBadge}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Content Placements"
+  desc="Use the `placement` prop to change the placement of the badge content. The default placement is `top-right`."
+  files={badgeContent.contentPlacementsBadge}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Content Shape"
+  desc="Use the `shape` prop to place the badge content relative to the corner of the children element. The default shape is `rectangle`."
+  files={badgeContent.contentShapeBadge}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Content Visibility"
+  desc="The visibility of badges can be controlled using the `isInvisible` prop."
+  files={badgeContent.contentVisibilityBadge}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Content Offset"
+  desc="You can use the `verticalOffset` and `horizontalOffset` props to adjust the position of the badge content. The default offset is `5%` for rectangles and `15%` for circles."
+  files={badgeContent.contentOffset}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Disable Outline"
+  desc="Use the `disableOutline` prop to remove the outline from the badge. The default outline is `2px` with a `solid` background color."
+  files={badgeContent.disableOutline}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Accessibility"
+  desc="You shouldn't rely on the content of the badge to be announced correctly. You should provide a full description, for instance, with `aria-label`."
+  files={badgeContent.a11y}
+/>
+
+<Spacer y={3} />
+
+### APIs
+
+<Spacer y={2} />
+
+#### Badge Props
+
+| Attribute            | Type                                 | Description                                                                        | Default     |
+| -------------------- | ------------------------------------ | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------- |
+| **children**         | `ReactNode`                          | The wrapped component.                                                             | -           |
+| **content**          | `string` `number` `ReactNode`        | The content of the badge. The badge will be rendered relative to its **children**. | -           |
+| **color**            | [SimpleColors](#simple-colors)       | The badge color.                                                                   | `default`   |
+| **size**             | [NormalSizes](#normal-sizes)         | The badge size.                                                                    | `md`        |
+| **variant**          | [BadgeVariant](#badge-variants)      | The badge variation.                                                               | `default`   |
+| **placement**        | [BadgePlacements](#badge-placements) | The placement of the badge **content**.                                            | `top-right` |
+| **borderWeight**     | [NormalWeights](#normal-weights)     | The border weight for **bordered** badge variation.                                | `normal`    |
+| **shape**            | `circle` `rectangle`                 | The wrapped shape the badge should overlap.                                        | `rectangle` |
+| **horizontalOffset** | `string` `number`                    | The horizontal offset of the badge **content**.                                    | -           |
+| **verticalOffset**   | `string` `number`                    | The vertical offset of the badge **content**.                                      | -           |
+| **isInvisible**      | `boolean`                            | Whether the badge is invisible.                                                    | `false`     |
+| **enableShadow**     | `boolean`                            | Whether the badge shadow should be enabled.                                        | `false`     |
+| **isSquared**        | `boolean`                            | Whether the badge corners should be squared.                                       | `false`     |
+| **disableOutline**   | `boolean`                            | Whether the badge outline should be disabled.                                      | `false`     |
+| **disableAnimation** | `boolean`                            | Whether the badge **content** animation should be disabled.                | `false`     |
+| **css**              | `Stitches.CSS`                       | Override Default CSS style.                                                        | -           |
+| **as**               | `keyof JSX.IntrinsicElements`        | Changes which tag component outputs.                                               | `span`      |
+
+---
+
+<Spacer y={2} />
+
+### Badge types
+
+#### Simple Colors
+
+```ts
+type SimpleColors =
+  | "default"
+  | "primary"
+  | "secondary"
+  | "success"
+  | "warning"
+  | "error";
+```
+
+#### Normal Sizes
+
+```ts
+type NormalSizes = "xs" | "sm" | "md" | "lg" | "xl";
+```
+
+<Spacer y={1} />
+
+#### Badge Variants
+
+```ts
+type BadgeVariants = "default" | "flat" | "dot" | "points" | "bordered";
+```
+
+#### Badge Placements
+
+```ts
+type BadgePlacements =
+  | "top-right"
+  | "top-left"
+  | "bottom-right"
+  | "bottom-left";
+```
+
+#### Normal Weights
+
+```ts
+type NormalWeights = "light" | "normal" | "bold" | "extrabold" | "black";
+```

A member of the Team first needs to [authorize it](https://vercel.com/git/authorize?team=NextUI&type=github&job=%7B%22headInfo%22%3A%7B%22sha%22%3A%228cccb06d225f81b8b0c3520166bba97615bd2c46%22%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%22QmSvjDjuSSay4n4VyYnrNdnD2i76GxhGREY1JhNCxumSaL%22%2C%22org%22%3A%22nextui-org%22%2C%22prId%22%3A601%2C%22repo%22%3A%22nextui%22%7D).

nodes.title: fix(docs): Kbar change theme
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #598
📝 Description
Kbar was using a function changeTheme that was not related to next-themes. This was create a misalignment in some part of the docs app.
My approach was to make Kbar Change Theme functionality use next-themes hook to change theme.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Some styles work not being correctly applied on theme change.
🚀 New behavior
Theme is applied correctly.
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No

nodes.title: fix(react-card): box shadow applied intead of box shadow filter on sa…
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #578
🚀 New behavior
Card's shadows are working on safari, it looks like safari doesn't support really well the drop-shadow filter, we use it because it's useful to not lose the outline of the card when in pressed/navigated by the keyboard
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): No

📝 Additional Information

nodes.bodyText:
Hi @himself65 thanks for your contribution, but the dependencies cause Tooltip component to loop infinitely.
It seems to me that doesn't really need dependencies, as useResize jsut add/remove event listener when the component is mounted/unmounted or run callback immediately.

Handle docs Tooltip what trigger with click to showing it's contents.

https://nextui.org/docs/components/tooltip#trigger
https://nextui.org/docs/components/tooltip#custom-content
these Tooltip does not work.
also storyboard too.

replace Button what Tooltip's children to Link

nodes.title: feat(react-container): add forwardRef
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #566 
📝 Description
Allow passing ref to Container
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Doesn't allow to pass ref.
🚀 New behavior
Allows passing ref.
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No

nodes.body:
> here please pass a ref from the function `useDomRef`, something like this
> 
> ```
>    import {useDOMRef} from "../utils/dom";
>    //....
>    const domRef = useDOMRef(ref);
>  // .....
>  return (
>       <StyledContainer
>         ref={domRef}
> //......
> ```

I made the change. Out of curiosity, could you please explain why you prefer this way, even tho you do not give any use to the ref created inside the component?
Could you please fix the conflicts? @danielsimao 🙏🏻
@jrgarciadev done
Thanks a lot! @danielsimao 🚀
Thanks a lot! @danielsimao 🚀
@jrgarciadev since you allow this component to be polymorphic (because of the `as` prop), I have added a more ambiguous type for html element. Do you agree?

nodes.body: please delete spaces
I made the change. Out of curiosity, could you please explain why you prefer this way, even tho you do not give any use to the ref created inside the component?

nodes.bodyText:
Thanks a lot, @danielsimao 🙏🏻, I prefer the way of using the ref through the useDomRef because it customises the instance value that is exposed to parent components, it allows us to have better control of the internal ref, here's the official docs:
https://reactjs.org/docs/hooks-reference.html#useimperativehandle

nodes.title: fix(react-table): react-stately props
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #557  
📝 Description
It's not possible to replicate the same issue locally in storybook, but I noticed that some props from @react-stately/table hook useTableState were being wrongly spread into StyledTable. That's why the dom was complaining regarding the onSelectionChange, because that event does not exist natively.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
I'm not changing any behaviour, just strictly passing the correct props.
🚀 New behavior
No new behaviour.
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No.
📝 Additional Information
Would be nice to understand why the storybook instance is suppressing this error.
@jrgarciadev, let me know if you agree with my commit text.

nodes.body: hey @danielsimao could you please fix the conflicts? 🙏🏻
@jrgarciadev `next` branch does not have `prettier` file.
Hey @danielsimao , no It doesn't have a `prettier` file because `prettier` config was moved to the `eslint` file

nodes.bodyText: Huge thanks! @danielsimao 🙏🏻

nodes.title: [Feature] Additional  sizes and fontSizes, better eslint/prettier configuration
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description
More space units were added, and to make the codebase more readable some fontSizes and lineHeights were renamed from xl2...xl9 to  2xl...9xl, besides a new eslint config was implemented
🚀 New behavior

New space units were added to the common theme 2xl...9xl, min: "min-content", max: "max-content", fit: "fit-content", screen: "100vw", full: "100%"
Text component now supports any value from fontSizes (e.g. "3xl") theme in addition to number (e.g. 14) and string (e.g. "20px")

e.g.
import {Text} from "@nextui-org/react";


function App({ Component }) {
  return (
    <Text size="4xl">Hello World</Text> 
  );
}

All files were updated to match with new eslint rules.
Default .vscode settings were updated to match with new eslint rules and help new contributors to get started.
Better eslint configuration for the project.
Better prettier configuration for the project.

💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): Yes

The margin prop removed from the Text component
Some fontSizes were renamed from xl2...xl9 to  2xl...9xl
Some lineHeights were renamed from xl2...xl9 to  2xl...9xl

📝 Additional Information
The idea is to implement the same Text size behavior in the future in other components like Grid, Row etc. to take advantage of the theme tokens

commit.message: refactor(react-theme): new sizes added, some fontSizes/linHeights renamed, text component now partially support fontsize tokens
refactor(root): eslint config and files changed
refactor(root): new eslint config implemented on react package
feat(react-text): now users can use any of the fontSizes theme tokens on the size prop
fix(react-config): 'React' is declared but its value is never read"

nodes.title: fix: Switch Animation In Safari
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #525
📝 Description

Add a brief description

⛳️ Current behavior (updates)

Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying

Switch circle is shaking when we off switch
🚀 New behavior

Please describe the behavior or changes this PR adds

💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): No

📝 Additional Information
Shaking bug is solved but there is some lag because width animation is very heavy.
It's fine at Chrome but it seems Safari cannot process this kind of animation well.
Option1:
So I would like to suggest to remove width animation in active state.
Option2:
Or if you want to maintain current interaction.
We can change prop checked to css &:checked + .circle.

commit.message: fix: active transform based on animated

nodes.body: @jrgarciadev I apply option2 so we can maintain existing interactions with no lag or shaking bug

nodes.title: fix(react-table): Table.Pagination component doesn't update with Table.Body
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #543
📝 Description
Updating <Table /> component can be a usual action, as mentioned in #543. However, <Table.Pagination> does not update synchronically with <Table.Body />, which results in two bugs:

<Table.Pagination /> length doesn't change. So when rows number is larger after the update, some pages can not be selected via <Table.Pagination />.
When rows number is smaller comparing to the previous table, the original page of <Table.Pagination /> is automatically selected and a blank table is showed.3.

This is because:

The table context collection never updates when rows data change.
<Pagination /> is not properly controlled as it does not receive the page prop.

⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
#543 described it thoroughly. I've added a new story here so it would be clearer to test.

🚀 New behavior

💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): No

📝 Additional Information

nodes.body: As agreed with @imchell, I will add some test cases to his PR.

in my opinion, this should not be a story, because it is a normal behaviour. But I think you could add some tests cases, that would check for this.

You can add me to the repo if you need some help regarding that.
How do you use this?
Thanks for reviewing it @danielsimao ! I think a test would be great but I'm not sure to what extent a test can do (forgive me I'm not a pro in test).

This is used to avoid losing control of `page` when switching between tables. The pagination would look like this without `page={currentPage}`:
![test](https://us1.myximage.com/2022/06/23/8e7585ba80da77f1dc4d326d466c1063.gif)
Note that the pointer moves to the left arrow at first.
@jrgarciadev probably this does not look great to you and I apologise, I'm not very familiar with enzyme. What I try to check here is that indeed the pagination reset when there is an items update.

nodes.title: fix #538
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description
fixed the bug where trigger="click" doesn't work on the tooltip component
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Tooltip trigger="click" works fine
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No

nodes.body: Nice work @JigolKa. I have thought of this but didn't come up with a solution to nested interaction.

Hey @JigolKa I appreciate your contribution, however, our idea to fix this is to migrate the current tooltip impl to [react aria tooltip](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/react-aria/useTooltipTrigger.html ) this is going to be carried out by one of the core members since it requires changes on the current tooltip APIs

nodes.title: Need Import React in Example
nodes.bodyText:
When trying to replicate the example it will fail since in the example the React instance is being requested in:
     return {
                ...initialProps,
                styles: React.Children.toArray([initialProps.styles])
     //                  ^
};
  }
and this at no time matters

Closes # 
📝 Description

When trying to replicate the example it will fail since in the example the React instance is being requested and this at no time matters

⛳️ Current behavior (updates)

I add the line import React from 'react'

🚀 New behavior

Please describe the behavior or changes this PR adds

At the time of following the steps and copying and pasting the example, this error will stop appearing

💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):  No

📝 Additional Information
It's something simple that users can add, but for novice programmers it can be a headache to understand what is going wrong, and the idea that the learning curve or creating your project can be as simple as copy and paste.

nodes.body: Hey @MrScrappy , thanks 🙌🏻

nodes.title: fix(react-modal): animation for backdrop
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description

Add a brief description

Original backdrop didn't perform transition or animation when it shows up. I did find that there are some transition codes in StyledBackdropLayer but they didn't come into effect because there was no change in opacity after backdrop had been rendered.

Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying

Modal is set to invisible for illustration purpose.
Before:

After:

🚀 New behavior

Please describe the behavior or changes this PR adds

Add fade-in effect for backdrop. It applies to opacity & backdrop filter.
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): No

📝 Additional Information

feat: React v18 support

fix: Card internal components hover and text copy
feat: Card new prop allowTextSelectionOnPress added to control whether text selection should be enabled on the pressable element.
fix: Dropdown trigger ref forwarded
fix: Press props are now being passed to the button

📝 Additional Information

@@ -88,17 +88,18 @@ import { Card } from '@nextui-org/react';
 
 #### Card Props
 
-| Attribute            | Type                             | Description                                                         | Default  |
-| -------------------- | -------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------- |
-| **children\***       | `ReactNode` `ReactNode[]`        | The content of the card. It's usually the header, body, and footer. | -        |
-| **variant**          | [CardVariants](#card-variants)   | The card variant style.                                             | `shadow` |
-| **borderWeight**     | [NormalWeights](#normal-weights) | The border weight of the bordered card.                             | `light`  |
-| **isHoverable**      | `boolean`                        | Whether the card can be hovered by the user.                        | `false`  |
-| **isPressable**      | `boolean`                        | Whether the card should allow users to interact with the card.      | `false`  |
-| **disableAnimation** | `boolean`                        | Whether the card is animated.                                       | `false`  |
-| **disableRipple**    | `boolean`                        | Whether the card should show a ripple animation on press            | `false`  |
-| **css**              | `Stitches.CSS`                   | Override Default CSS style.                                         | -        |
-| **as**               | `keyof JSX.IntrinsicElements`    | Changes which tag component outputs.                                | `div`    |
+| Attribute                     | Type                             | Description                                                                       | Default  |
+| ----------------------------- | -------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------- |
+| **children\***                | `ReactNode` `ReactNode[]`        | The content of the card. It's usually the header, body, and footer.               | -        |
+| **variant**                   | [CardVariants](#card-variants)   | The card variant style.                                                           | `shadow` |
+| **borderWeight**              | [NormalWeights](#normal-weights) | The border weight of the bordered card.                                           | `light`  |
+| **isHoverable**               | `boolean`                        | Whether the card can be hovered by the user.                                      | `false`  |
+| **isPressable**               | `boolean`                        | Whether the card should allow users to interact with the card.                    | `false`  |
+| **disableAnimation**          | `boolean`                        | Whether the card is animated.                                                     | `false`  |
+| **disableRipple**             | `boolean`                        | Whether the card should show a ripple animation on press                          | `false`  |
+| **allowTextSelectionOnPress** | `boolean`                        | Whether the card should allow text selection on press. (only for pressable cards) | `true`   |
+| **css**                       | `Stitches.CSS`                   | Override Default CSS style.                                                       | -        |
+| **as**                        | `keyof JSX.IntrinsicElements`    | Changes which tag component outputs.                                              | `div`    |
 
 <Spacer y={1} />

nodes.title: Fix 522/ssr provider inconsintent ids
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #401
Closes #522
📝 Description
This PR allows users to use React v18 and fix the card ids mismatch issue.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Support is provided only for React v17 and below.
Card ids mismatch issue.
🚀 New behavior
The react-aria packages have been upgraded to the last version, which includes the fix for the card ids mismatch issue and the support for React v18.
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): No
📝 Additional Information

commit.message: Merge branch 'next' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into fix_522/ssr-provider-inconsintent-ids

nodes.title: chore(repo): upgraded storybook and cleaned up the css type
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description
The current storybook version 6.5.3 has an emotion :first-child error and emotion 11 has been supported since storybook 6.5, which avoids the incompatibility of the css types defined globally by emotion with the css type of stitches.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)

Upgraded storybook to version 6.5.12.
Cleaned up the css prop of any type.
Fixed emotion :first-child warning by upgrading storybook.
Fixed Card shadow in stories.


💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No

commit.message: chore(react): cleaned up the css prop of any type
chore(docs): cleaned up the css prop of any type
chore(react): fixed storybook react version conflicts
chore(repo): upgraded storybook to latest version
chore(repo): upgraded storybook to latest version 6.5.12
chore(react): import css as type and memorize css

nodes.title: fix(react-card): internal components hover and text copy
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description
This PR solve the card internal components hover/focus/click issue.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Currently users can't hover/focus/click the card internal components.
🚀 New behavior
pressProps, focusProps and hoverProps are now being conditionally applied to the card depending on whether the isPressable and isHoverable props are set to true.
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): No

📝 Additional Information

commit.message: fix(react-card): internal components hover and text copy

nodes.title: fix: card text selection
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description
Texts on card components can not be selected by mouse when they are not pressable.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Texts can not be selected nor copied.
🚀 New behavior
Texts can be selected and copied.
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): No

📝 Additional Information
This is a bug invoked by react-aria usePress. According to the author of usePress() (explained here, which also involved the card implementation), we should avoid it when the card is not pressable. Correct me if I'm wrong 😂 not a pro of react-aria

files_with_diffs.patch:
@@ -237,23 +237,19 @@ import { Dropdown } from '@nextui-org/react';
 
 #### Dropdown.Item Props
 
-| Attribute         | Type                                                | Description                                                             | Default   |
-| ----------------- | --------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------- |
-| **key**           | [Key](https://reactjs.org/docs/lists-and-keys.html) | The unique key for the menu item.                                       | `false`   |
-| **command**       | `boolean`                                           | Right-aligned label text content, useful for displaying hotkeys.        | -         |
-| **description**   | `boolean`                                           | Description text element inside the dropdown menu item.                 | -         |
-| **icon**          | `ReactNode`                                         | The icon to render before the dropdown menu item's label.               | -         |
-| **isSelected**    | `boolean`                                           | Whether the dropdown item is selected.                                  | `false`   |
-| **isDisabled**    | `boolean`                                           | Whether the dropdown item is disabled.                                  | `false`   |
-| **isVirtualized** | `boolean`                                           | Whether the dropdown item is contained in a virtual scrolling dropdown. | `false`   |
-| **closeOnSelect** | `boolean`                                           | Whether the dropdown should close when the dropdown item is selected.   | `true`    |
-| **withDivider**   | `boolean`                                           | Whether the dropdown item should have a border on top                   | `false`   |
-| **dividerWeight** | [NormalWeight](#normal-weight)                      | The dropdown item divider height                                        | `light`   |
-| **color**         | [SimpleColors](#simple-colors)                      | The dropdown item color                                                 | `default` |
-| **textColor**     | [SimpleColors](#simple-colors)                      | The dropdown item text color                                            | `default` |
-| **variant**       | [DropdownVariant](#dropdown-variants)               | The dropdown item variantion                                            | `flat`    |
-| **css**           | `Stitches.CSS`                                      | Override Default CSS style.                                             | -         |
-| **as**            | `keyof JSX.IntrinsicElements`                       | Changes which tag component outputs.                                    | `li`      |
+| Attribute         | Type                                                | Description                                                      | Default   |
+| ----------------- | --------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------- | --------- |
+| **key**           | [Key](https://reactjs.org/docs/lists-and-keys.html) | The unique key for the menu item.                                | `false`   |
+| **command**       | `boolean`                                           | Right-aligned label text content, useful for displaying hotkeys. | -         |
+| **description**   | `boolean`                                           | Description text element inside the dropdown menu item.          | -         |
+| **icon**          | `ReactNode`                                         | The icon to render before the dropdown menu item's label.        | -         |
+| **withDivider**   | `boolean`                                           | Whether the dropdown item should have a border on top            | `false`   |
+| **dividerWeight** | [NormalWeight](#normal-weight)                      | The dropdown item divider height                                 | `light`   |
+| **color**         | [SimpleColors](#simple-colors)                      | The dropdown item color                                          | `default` |
+| **textColor**     | [SimpleColors](#simple-colors)                      | The dropdown item text color                                     | `default` |
+| **variant**       | [DropdownVariant](#dropdown-variants)               | The dropdown item variantion                                     | `flat`    |
+| **css**           | `Stitches.CSS`                                      | Override Default CSS style.                                      | -         |
+| **as**            | `keyof JSX.IntrinsicElements`                       | Changes which tag component outputs.                             | `li`      |
 
 <Spacer y={1} />

nodes.title: v1.0.0-beta.8
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #474
Closes #509
Closes #174
Closes #301
📝 Description
NextUI new version v1.0.0-beta.8 🚀
🚀 New behaviour

[NEW COMPONENT]: Dropdown component has been created, based on react-aria hooks: useMenu useMenuItem useMenuSection useTreeState #507
New grey scale: in order to have better grey/dark contrast, a Slate one changed the grey palette #483
Refactor Radio and integration with react-aria/radio. #491
Card refactor and integration with usePress and useHover react-aria hooks. #511
Theme shadows have been improved and are now more consistent, a new key for drop shadows was added. #511
Theme font sizes have been improved and are now more consistent. #511
Theme line heights have been improved and are now more consistent. #511
Docs components and core components have been updated in order to fit the new font sizes and shadows #511

Utilities added to the Stitches CSS library:
+ ds: (value) => ({
+   dropShadow: value
+ }),
+ shadow: (value) => ({
+   boxShadow: value
+ }),
+ dshadow: (value) => ({
+   dropShadow: value
+ }),
+ dropShadow: (value) => ({
+   filter: `$dropShadows${value}`
+ }),
New theme key -> dropShadows (to use along with css dropShadow utility)
Light Theme:
  dropShadows: {
+    xs: 'drop-shadow(0 2px 4px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.07)) drop-shadow(0 1px 1px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.04))',
+    sm: 'drop-shadow(0 2px 8px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.07)) drop-shadow(0 2px 4px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.04))',
+    md: 'drop-shadow(0 4px 12px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.08)) drop-shadow(0 20px 8px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.04))',
+    lg: 'drop-shadow(0 12px 24px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.15)) drop-shadow(0 12px 14px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.1))',
+    xl: 'drop-shadow(0 25px 34px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.35))'
  }
Dark Theme:
  dropShadows: {
+    xs: 'drop-shadow(0 2px 4px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.07)) drop-shadow(0 1px 1px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.04))',
+    sm: 'drop-shadow(0 2px 8px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.07)) drop-shadow(0 2px 4px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.04))',
+    md: 'drop-shadow(0 4px 12px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.08)) drop-shadow(0 20px 8px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.04))',
+    lg: 'drop-shadow(0 12px 24px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.15)) drop-shadow(0 12px 14px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.1))',
+    xl: 'drop-shadow(0 25px 34px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.35))'
  }
Usage example:
<Button
  css={{
    dropShadow: "$lg",
  }}
/>
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): Yes
Card APIs breaking changes

bordered prop has been removed, use variant="bordered" instead.
shadow prop has been removed, use variant="shadow" instead.
cover prop has been removed, use objectFit="cover" image prop instead.




Old APIs
New APIs




clickable
isPressable


hoverable
isHoverable


animated
disableAnimation



Card.Footer APIs breaking changes



Old APIs
New APIs




blur
isBlurred



Card Implementation difference:
NextUI is no longer automatically wrapping the children in a Card.Body component (since it causes a lot of issues), it means that you have to do it yourself.
    <Card css={{ mw: "400px" }}>
+     <Card.Body>
        <Text>A basic card</Text>
+     </Card.Body>
    </Card>

Theme breaking changes
Font sizes breaking changes
  fontSizes: {
-   tiny: '.75rem',
-   xs: '0.875rem',
-   base: '1rem',
-   sm: '1.25rem',
-   md: '1.5rem',
-   lg: '2.25rem',
-   xl: '3rem'

+   xs: '0.75rem', /* 12px */
+   sm: '0.875rem', /* 14px */
+   base: '1rem', /* 16px */
+   md: '1rem', /* 16px */
+   lg: '1.125rem', /* 18px */
+   xl: '1.25rem', /* 20px */
+   xl2: '1.5rem', /* 24px */
+   xl3: '1.875rem', /* 30px */
+   xl4: '2.25rem', /* 36px */
+   xl5: '3rem', /* 48px */
+   xl6: '3.75rem', /* 60px */
+   xl7: '4.5rem', /* 72px */
+   xl8: '6rem', /* 96px */
+   xl9: '8rem', /* 128px */
  }
Line heights breaking changes
  lineHeights: {
-   xs: 1,
-   sm: 1.25,
-   md: 1.5,
-   lg: 1.625,
-   xl: 1.75

+   xs: 1, /* 16px */
+   sm: 1.25, /* 20px */
+   base: 1.5, /* 24px */
+   md: 1.5, /* 24px */
+   lg: 1.75, /* 28px */
+   xl: 1.75, /* 28px */
+   xl2: 2, /* 32px */
+   xl3: 2.25, /* 36px */
+   xl4: 2.5, /* 40px */
+   xl5: 1,
+   xl6: 1,
+   xl7: 1,
+   xl8: 1,
+   xl9: 1
  }
Shadows breaking changes
Light Theme:
  shadows: {
-   xs: '-4px 0 4px rgb(0 0 0 / 5%);',
-   sm: '0 5px 20px -5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1)',
-   md: '0 8px 30px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.15)',
-   lg: '0 30px 60px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.15)',
-   xl: '0 40px 80px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25)'

+   xs: '0 2px 8px 1px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.07), 0 1px 1px -1px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.04)',
+   sm: '0 2px 8px 2px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.07), 0 2px 4px -1px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.04)',
+   md: '0 12px 20px 6px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.08)',
+   lg: '0 12px 34px 6px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.18)',
+   xl: '0 25px 65px 0px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.35)'
  }
Dark Theme:
  shadows: {
-   xs: '-4px 0 15px rgb(0 0 0 / 50%)',
-   sm: '0 5px 20px -5px rgba(20, 20, 20, 0.1)',
-   md: '0 8px 30px rgba(20, 20, 20, 0.15)',
-   lg: '0 30px 60px rgba(20, 20, 20, 0.15)',
-   xl: '0 40px 80px rgba(20, 20, 20, 0.25)'

+   xs: '0 2px 8px 1px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.07), 0 1px 1px -1px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.04)',
+   sm: '0 2px 8px 2px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.07), 0 2px 4px -1px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.04)',
+   md: '0 12px 20px 6px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.08)',
+   lg: '0 12px 34px 6px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.18)',
+   xl: '0 25px 65px 0px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.35)'
  }
Radio APIs breaking changes

Radio needs to be wrapped in the Radio.Group.

Radio Props



OLD APIs
NEW APIs




textColor
labelColor


animated
disableAnimation


squared
isSquared


disabled
isDisabled



Radio Group Props



OLD APIs
NEW APIs




textColor
labelColor


value: string, number
value: string


initialValue: string, number
defaultValue: string


disabled
isDisabled


onChange: (e:RadioEvent) => void
onChange: (value: T) => void




row prop has been removed, use orientation="horizontal" instead.
Radio.Description and Radio.Desc sub-components have been removed, use description prop instead.

-  <Radio.Group value="1" row>
+ <Radio.Group value="1" orientation="horizontal">
-      <Radio value="1">
-        Option 1<Radio.Description>Description for Option1</Radio.Description>
-      </Radio>
+     <Radio value="1" description="Description for Option1">
+        Option 1
+      </Radio>
  </Radio.Group>
Checkbox APIs breaking changes

row prop has been removed, use orientation="horizontal" instead.


📝 Additional Information

commit.message: Merge branch 'next' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into feat/dropdown-component
fix: user prop and user link warnings

Merge pull request #483 from nextui-org/refactor/theme-gray-scale

Refactor/theme gray scale
Merge branch 'next' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into feat/dropdown-component
feat(react-dropdown): dropdown menu is working, styles and API missing
chore(react-dropdown): documentation improved, trigger type is now beign passed
feat(react-dropdown): compound pattern implemented, shared css moved to a separated file called `shared-css`
feat(react-dropdown): dropdown-item styles improved, button icon css props added, some dropdown stories added

theme: Amend utility function `bgBlur` to not modulate background value

Amends the Stitches utility function `bgBlur` to set the passed background-color value as-is instead of appending `66` (for alpha), which only works for hex color codes.

This change enables passing other color code formats, like `hsla()` and `rgb()`, just like the rest of NextUI. The previous implementation confuses users for why their color value does not work.

Second, the previous implementation of setting the passed color alpha to 66% is hidden from the user. If the user wants to pass a value with a particular alpha that is not 66%, she must think about the additional 66% modification happening to her color.

For example, I would like to set the background color for this blur effect to exactly `hsla(0, 0%, 100%, 0.1)`, where I can easily tweak the alpha value. However, this color code format is incompatible with the current implementation for the reason explained above. Second, if I instead find the corresponding hex color code for this value, I can not tweak the alpha easily; and when I do, I must also account for the 66% happening in the background.

Merge pull request #485 from DannyNemer/danny/bgblur

theme: Amend utility function `bgBlur` to not modulate background value
Merge branch 'main' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into next
chore(react-dropdown): outline applied to shadow items

Merge pull request #492 from tianenpang/feat/storybook-theme-toggle

feat(storybook): theme toggle with nextui
Merge branch 'next' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into feat/dropdown-component
feat(react-dropdown): command added to the end of the list item
refactor(react-button): padding removed when there's no a child
feat(react-dropdown): icon and description variations added, new utils for truncating text added
refactor(react-radio): update docs, unit tests and radio desc types
feat(react-dropdown): single and multiple selection done
feat(react-dropdown): test added, checkmark icon added fo single and multiple selection
feat(react-dropdown): avatar and user supported as a trigged

Merge pull request #507 from nextui-org/feat/dropdown-component

Feat/dropdown component
Merge branch 'main' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into next

Merge pull request #491 from tianenpang/refactor/radio

refactor(react-radio): integration with react-aria radio
refactor(react-radio): description component have been moved to the prop "description", invalid state added and more
chore(react-input): label left/right now accept a react node
refactor(react-radio): isRow prop changed by orientation horizontal
refactor(docs-checkbox): no animated changed by disable animation title
refactor(react-card): card props and behaviour in progress

+const App = `import React from "react";
+import { Grid, Dropdown, Radio } from "@nextui-org/react";
+
+export default function App() {
+  const [selectedColor, setSelectedColor] = React.useState("default");
+  const colors = [
+    "default",
+    "primary",
+    "secondary",
+    "success",
+    "warning",
+    "error",
+  ];
+
+  const capitalize = (str) => {
+    const lower = str.toLowerCase();
+    return str.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + lower.slice(1);
+  };
+
+  return (
+    <Grid.Container gap={1.5} justify="flex-start">
+      <Grid xs={12}>
+        <Grid>
+          <Dropdown>
+            <Dropdown.Button color={selectedColor} light>
+              Light
+            </Dropdown.Button>
+            <Dropdown.Menu
+              color={selectedColor}
+              variant="light"
+              aria-label="Actions"
+            >
+              <Dropdown.Item key="new">New file</Dropdown.Item>
+              <Dropdown.Item key="copy">Copy link</Dropdown.Item>
+              <Dropdown.Item key="edit">Edit file</Dropdown.Item>
+              <Dropdown.Item key="delete" color="error" withDivider>
+                Delete file
+              </Dropdown.Item>
+            </Dropdown.Menu>
+          </Dropdown>
+        </Grid>
+        <Grid>
+          <Dropdown>
+            <Dropdown.Button flat color={selectedColor}>
+              Flat
+            </Dropdown.Button>
+            <Dropdown.Menu color={selectedColor} aria-label="Actions">
+              <Dropdown.Item key="new">New file</Dropdown.Item>
+              <Dropdown.Item key="copy">Copy link</Dropdown.Item>
+              <Dropdown.Item key="edit">Edit file</Dropdown.Item>
+              <Dropdown.Item key="delete" color="error" withDivider>
+                Delete file
+              </Dropdown.Item>
+            </Dropdown.Menu>
+          </Dropdown>
+        </Grid>
+        <Grid>
+          <Dropdown>
+            <Dropdown.Button color={selectedColor}>Solid</Dropdown.Button>
+            <Dropdown.Menu
+              color={selectedColor}
+              variant="solid"
+              aria-label="Actions"
+            >
+              <Dropdown.Item key="new">New file</Dropdown.Item>
+              <Dropdown.Item key="copy">Copy link</Dropdown.Item>
+              <Dropdown.Item key="edit">Edit file</Dropdown.Item>
+              <Dropdown.Item key="delete" color="error" withDivider>
+                Delete file
+              </Dropdown.Item>
+            </Dropdown.Menu>
+          </Dropdown>
+        </Grid>
+        <Grid>
+          <Dropdown>
+            <Dropdown.Button color={selectedColor} shadow>
+              Shadow
+            </Dropdown.Button>
+            <Dropdown.Menu
+              color={selectedColor}
+              variant="shadow"
+              aria-label="Actions"
+            >
+              <Dropdown.Item key="new">New file</Dropdown.Item>
+              <Dropdown.Item key="copy">Copy link</Dropdown.Item>
+              <Dropdown.Item key="edit">Edit file</Dropdown.Item>
+              <Dropdown.Item key="delete" color="error" withDivider>
+                Delete file
+              </Dropdown.Item>
+            </Dropdown.Menu>
+          </Dropdown>
+        </Grid>
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid xs={12}>
+        <Radio.Group
+          size="sm"
+          orientation="horizontal"
+          value={selectedColor}
+          onChange={setSelectedColor}
+        >
+          {colors.map((color) => (
+            <Radio key={color} value={color} color={selectedColor}>
+              {capitalize(color)}
+            </Radio>
+          ))}
+        </Radio.Group>
+      </Grid>
+    </Grid.Container>
+  );
+}`;
+
+const react = {
+  '/App.js': App
+};
+
+export default {
+  ...react
+};

nodes.title: Refactor/card component
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #174 #301
📝 Description

Card refactor and integration with usePress and useHover hooks.
Theme shadows have been improved and are now more consistent, a new key for drop shadows was added.
Theme font sizes have been improved and are now more consistent.
Theme line heights have been improved and are now more consistent.
Docs components and core compoennts have been updated in order to fit the new font sizes and shadows

🚀 New behavior
Utilities added to the Stitches CSS library:
+ ds: (value) => ({
+   dropShadow: value
+ }),
+ shadow: (value) => ({
+   boxShadow: value
+ }),
+ dshadow: (value) => ({
+   dropShadow: value
+ }),
+ dropShadow: (value) => ({
+   filter: `$dropShadows${value}`
+ }),
New theme key -> dropShadows (to use along with css dropShadow utility)
Light Theme:
  dropShadows: {
+    xs: 'drop-shadow(0 2px 4px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.07)) drop-shadow(0 1px 1px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.04))',
+    sm: 'drop-shadow(0 2px 8px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.07)) drop-shadow(0 2px 4px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.04))',
+    md: 'drop-shadow(0 4px 12px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.08)) drop-shadow(0 20px 8px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.04))',
+    lg: 'drop-shadow(0 12px 24px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.15)) drop-shadow(0 12px 14px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.1))',
+    xl: 'drop-shadow(0 25px 34px rgb(104 112 118 / 0.35))'
  }
Dark Theme:
  dropShadows: {
+    xs: 'drop-shadow(0 2px 4px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.07)) drop-shadow(0 1px 1px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.04))',
+    sm: 'drop-shadow(0 2px 8px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.07)) drop-shadow(0 2px 4px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.04))',
+    md: 'drop-shadow(0 4px 12px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.08)) drop-shadow(0 20px 8px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.04))',
+    lg: 'drop-shadow(0 12px 24px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.15)) drop-shadow(0 12px 14px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.1))',
+    xl: 'drop-shadow(0 25px 34px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.35))'
  }
Usage example:
<Button
  css={{
    dropShadow: "$lg",
  }}
/>
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): Yes

Card APIs breaking changes

bordered prop has been removed, use variant="bordered" instead.
shadow prop has been removed, use variant="shadow" instead.
cover prop has been removed, use objectFit="cover" image prop instead.




Old APIs
New APIs




clickable
isPressable


hoverable
isHoverable


animated
disableAnimation



Card.Footer APIs breaking changes



Old APIs
New APIs




blur
isBlurred



Card Implementation difference:
NextUI is no longer automatically wrapping the children in a Card.Body component (since it causes a lot of issues), it means that you have to do it yourself.
    <Card css={{ mw: "400px" }}>
+     <Card.Body>
        <Text>A basic card</Text>
+     </Card.Body>
    </Card>

Theme breaking changes
Font sizes breaking changes
  fontSizes: {
-   tiny: '.75rem',
-   xs: '0.875rem',
-   base: '1rem',
-   sm: '1.25rem',
-   md: '1.5rem',
-   lg: '2.25rem',
-   xl: '3rem'

+   xs: '0.75rem', /* 12px */
+   sm: '0.875rem', /* 14px */
+   base: '1rem', /* 16px */
+   md: '1rem', /* 16px */
+   lg: '1.125rem', /* 18px */

feat(react): card refactor completed, dropShadows added, shadows improved
feat(react-baseline): text sizes and shadows improved
feat(react-docs): new font sizes implemented, shadows improved, card component docs updated
Merge branch 'next' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into refactor/card-component

+const App = `import { Card } from "@nextui-org/react";
+
+export default function App() {
+  return (
+    <Grid.Container gap={2}>
+      <Grid xs={4}>
+        <Card>
+          <Card.Body>
+            <Text>Default card. (shadow)</Text>
+          </Card.Body>
+        </Card>
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid xs={4}>
+        <Card variant="flat">
+          <Card.Body>
+            <Text>Flat card.</Text>
+          </Card.Body>
+        </Card>
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid xs={4}>
+        <Card variant="bordered">
+          <Card.Body>
+            <Text>Bordered card.</Text>
+          </Card.Body>
+        </Card>
+      </Grid>
+    </Grid.Container>
+  );
+}`;
+
+const react = {
+  '/App.js': App
+};
+
+export default {
+  ...react
+};

@@ -16,40 +16,49 @@ import { Card } from '@nextui-org/react'; +#### Anatomy + +- **Card**: The wrapper that provides state, context and focus management. +- **Card.Header**: Commonly used for the title of a card. +- **Card.Body**: The content of the card. +- **Card.Footer**: Commonly used for actions. +- **Card.Image**: The image of the card, based on the NextUI [Image](/docs/components/image). +- **Card.Divider**: A divider between cards. + + + +> **Note**: NextUI uses the **react-aria** [useHover](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/react-aria/useHover.html) hook under the hood in order to handle mouse and touch events, ignore emulated mouse events in mobile browsers, and other accessibility features. + - +> **Note**: NextUI uses the **react-aria** [usePress](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/react-aria/usePress.html) hook under the hood in order to handle mouse and touch events, Enter and Space keys, screen readers virtual clicks, and other accessibility features. @@ -61,14 +70,13 @@ import { Card } from '@nextui-org/react'; nodes.title: fix(react-table): safari row jitters on hover
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #509
📝 Description
Table row jitters when mouse enters it on Safari
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Looks like safari has a slight flicker on transforms animations https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3461441/prevent-flicker-on-webkit-transition-of-webkit-transform
🚀 New behavior
The issue has been fixed by adding:
  transform: 'translateZ(0)',
  backfaceVisibility: 'hidden'
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): No

📝 Additional Information
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3461441/prevent-flicker-on-webkit-transition-of-webkit-transform
